dt: {bc}a usually {d_link|multilingual|multilingual} hotel staff member who handles luggage and mail, makes reservations, and arranges tours

dt.t: In any great European hotel, the most important figure with whom the clients deal directly is usually the {wi}concierge{/wi} …

dt: {bc}a person or service that provides assistance with personal business (such as making travel arrangements, scheduling appointments, or running errands)

dt.t: That's why she plunks down $150 per month of her hard-earned cash for a personal {wi}concierge{/wi}: To "buy back" her time and free herself from the relentless errands that sap her off-work hours.
Medical care is left to professionals. Instead, {wi}concierges{/wi} help out around the house, get their client to appointments, join them for recreation and run small errands.

As we increasingly find ourselves feeling time poor, with not enough hours in the day to get everything done, virtual {wi}concierges{/wi} are popping up to help with everything from gift shopping to finding a new outfit for a holiday party.

For $250-per-year, members would gain entry to exclusive celebrity events, a {wi}concierge{/wi} service to score hard-to-get concert tickets and restaurant reservations, and access to a swanky, shared hangout pad.

dt: {bc}a resident in an apartment building especially in France who serves as doorkeeper, landlord's representative, and janitor

et: French, from Old French, probably from Vulgar Latin {it}*conservius{/it}, alteration of Latin {it}conservus{/it} fellow slave, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}servus{/it} slave
shortdef: a usually multilingual hotel staff member who handles luggage and mail, makes reservations, and arranges tours —sometimes used before another noun
a person or service that provides assistance with personal business (such as making travel arrangements, scheduling appointments, or running errands) —often used before another noun
a resident in an apartment building especially in France who serves as doorkeeper, landlord's representative, and janitor

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or being a health-care practice (as of {d_link|primary care|primary care} physicians) in which patients pay a membership fee for enhanced access and services

dt.t: Proponents of {wi}concierge{/wi} medicine insist that more time with each patient allows them to provide holistic care that can prevent diseases such as diabetes …
There has also been growth in so-called {wi}concierge{/wi} practices that offer in-home care as a luxury service.

shortdef: of, relating to, or being a health-care practice (as of primary care physicians) in which patients pay a membership fee for enhanced access and services
